item.title: [DEV-5382] Lead Feed BE - Update definition of `messageCount` to discard declined messages
item.description:
update server/src/secondaryAdapters/Repository/loaders/index.ts to include additional filter (Or poss in the graphql layer or another layer of abstraction? But there is fine)

Update server/src/app/logic/message.ts to filter message count by is rejected
(Poss abstract that part to just some named function somewhere, probs just in same file? Usually if a block of code, even a short one, requires a comment above it describing what it does, that comment should probably be turned into a function name, innit) 

  // Check if host has already sent a message for the enquiry
    // including rejected 
    const messageSentByHost = await repository.findMessagesCount({
      enquiryId: enquiry.id,
      hostId: message.hostId,
      excludeStatuses: [MessageStatus.SendFail],
    })
    // tslint:disable-next-line: no-if-statement
    if (messageSentByHost.length && messageSentByHost[0].count > 0) {
      throw new Error(`You have already sent a message`)
    }

    // Message count check of unrejected
    const messagesCount = await repository.findMessagesCount({
      enquiryId: enquiry.id,
      rejected: false,
      excludeStatuses: [MessageStatus.SendFail],
    })
item.summary: Lead Feed BE - Update definition of `messageCount` to discard declined messages

item.title: [DEV-5381] Gexp Fe - Message Page Declined State
item.description:
Declined state

  • The declined panel is shown instead of the prematch panel. The reasons the guest has submitted are listed below in alphabetical order.
  • Copy: �� ️You told us this venue is not a good match. Here’s why: [Listed reasons]
    e.g. �� ️You told us this venue is not a good match.
    Here’s why:
    - Location unsuitable
    - Style wrong
    - I didn’t like the layout.

Message

declined: Boolean
declinedAt: Date

DeclineReason

Interest

item.title: [DEV-5377] Lead Feed Backend - Add decline related columns to message table
item.description:
declined_at NULL or Datetime (default NULL, which represents not declined)
declined_reasons String Array (of ids) (default empty array, which represents both not set and no pre defined reasons given)
declined_other_reason NULL or String (default NULL which means no custom reason entered) Add a constraint for more than 3 characters

item.title: [DEV-5374] Lead Feed Backend - Create filter in interests page to filter for interests with declined messages
item.description:
From GraphQL’s pov interests are declined, and messages are declined too ��

if true show only those declined
if false show only those not declined
if not set show everything

In interests.ts rename mapInterestFilterToJoinCondition to mapInterestFilterToEnquiryJoinCondition and create a corresponding {{mapInterestFilterToMessageJoinCondition }}

item.title: [DEV-5373] Host - Messaged enquiry page banners
item.description:
Once a message is sent we show a banner on the top of the page that shows the host how long ago it was sent. Now that we are introducing the “seen” and “decline” status for messages we want to add two new banners on this page for these statuses.

"Sent” banner

  • Small copy change:
    Message sent successfully / Message sent to [guest name] [x] days ago
    If [Guest name] matches with your venue, we’ll let you know by email and you’ll be able to see their details under Interested Guests.
  • Note: Interested Guests links to the page.

“Seen” banner

  • If a message has been opened by a guest in GEXP (see https://headbox.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5333 ) and its status is, therefore ”seen” we show this banner on top of the messaged enquiry page.
  • This banner is displayed instead of the “message sent” banner
  • Copy:
    [Guest name] saw your message [x] days ago
    If [Guest name] matches with your venue, we’ll let you know by email and you’ll be able to see their details under Interested Guests.
  • New illustration
  • Note: Interested Guests links to the page.

“Declined” banner

  • If a message has been declined by a guest in GEXP and its status is, therefore ”declined” we show this banner on top of the messaged enquiry page.
  • This banner is displayed instead of the “message seen” banner.
  • Copy:
    [Guest name] declined your venue [x] hours ago
    Unfortunately, [guest name] decided to host their event somewhere else and has declined your venue.  

Their reasons for declining:
[bullet point list of reasons in alphabetical order]

Having trouble matching? Read our top tips here.

  • New illustration
  • Note: “Here” links to a blogpost:

Any of these banners will be replaced by the guest contact details of the guest matches with the venue.

Design

  • Figma: https://www.figma.com/file/zerDeP0FSvQfMhyloYKANR/Guest-experience?node-id=1645%3A27910
  • Note: These designs aren’t pixel perfect and more a rough guide on how the copy should look.
  • Please ask Ellen for the Illustrations.
item.summary: Host - Messaged enquiry page banners

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

item.title: [DEV-5370] Host - Message page - Table
item.description:
We want to show our hosts the messages they have sent to guest and their status on the new message page.

Table

The table shows all messages the host has sent to guests // that haven’t matched yet with the following columns:

  • Sent: [how long ago the message was sent]
  • Event info: [Event name] // [Event type]
  • Details: [Event budget in lead currency] // [Number of guests] [guests/standing/seating arrangement]
  • Timings: [Date in format Fri, 03 Jun 2022] // [Time or end date for multi day events] // [Flexible tag]
  • Status: Sent to guest/Seen by guest/Declined by guest/Matched by guest
  • Message: “Your message” button

The button leads to the corresponding messaged enquiry page of the lead.

If the guest goes to the enquiry page from the messages page the link in the top left corner should say “Go back to Messages” and should lead to the message page.

Message details

  • On click of the message the details should be displayed below the message - same behaviour as in LF but with different details:
  • Guest name: [First name of guest] [Last name of guest]
  • Your suggested venue: [name of venue the host but forward] / [Name of space the host put forward]
  • Message sent to guest: [x] days ago Note: Would be redundant information with first table column.
  • Message seen by guest: [x] days ago
  • Declined by guest: [x] days ago
    Reasons: [bullet point list of decline reasons in alphabetical order]
  • Matched by guest: [x] days ago
  • Only the information that is available for the message is displayed e.g. if a message has the status “seen” only “Message sent to guest” and “Message seen by guest” is displayed

Pagination

  • There should be a pagination on the page.
  • By default 50 messages should be shown per page with the option to reduce that to 25 or 10 per page.

Design

  • Figma: https://www.figma.com/file/zerDeP0FSvQfMhyloYKANR/Guest-experience?node-id=1646%3A28796
  • Please note the designs are not pixel perfect, please use the Lead Feed or Interested Guest as a guide for consistency.
item.summary: Host - Message page - Table

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

item.title: [DEV-5369] Host - Message page - Setup
item.description:
The new message page should have the following attributes:

Permission

  • The page should have the same permission and access rights as the other Lead Feed pages.

Tracking

  • Pendo should be set up on this page to allow us to track our user’s behaviour.

Tab

  • The tab of the message page should have the HeadBox “o” logo as its favicon.
  • Tab name: Your HeadBox enquiry - HeadBox

Responsiveness

  • Since this is part of the host experience this page doesn’t have to be fully responsive.
  • However, the page still needs to be usable with a horizontal scroll on smaller devices.

Headline

  • Headline: Your messages
  • Subtitle: [number of messages on page] sent messages
item.summary: Host - Message page - Setup

Next to the new link there should be a red “new” tag that disappears two weeks after prod release.

item.title: [DEV-5329] Host - Decline venue
item.description:
• Right now a maximum of 8 hosts can message a guest.
  • Once guests can decline venues that they didn’t like we want to give other hosts another chance to send the guest a message and put their venue forward.
  • This means that the message limit needs to change from 8 hosts that messaged the guest to 8 hosts that messaged the guest and didn’t get rejected.
  • In future, we want to show the declined host that they were declined why, but for now, we will only give hosts access to that data via CS/a mode report.

Lead Feed https://staging-e-tenders.headbox.com/leadfeed

  • On the Lead Feed the text “Responses closed” should change to the “I’m available” button for any hosts in the area that haven’t messaged the lead.
  • Hosts that have already messaged the lead will continue to see the “Your message” button.
  • If the host goes to the messaging page of a reactivated lead directly via the url they won’t see the error banner:
  • We won’t send out a new Lead Feed notification email once the lead becomes available again.

LF admin https://staging-app.headbox.com/admin/lf-leads

  • The “Host Messages” drawer/pagination needs to accommodate more than 8 messages.
  • In the “Host Messages” drawer we want to add a new detail below the Status (or add this as a new status) that shows if the message/venue was declined by the guest and why:
    Declined: Yes/No ([Reasons in alphabetical order, separated by commas])
item.summary: Host - Decline venue

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

item.title: [DEV-5328] Guest - Message page - Decline venue
item.description:
On the messaging page we want to give our users the option to decline the venue they are looking at and tell us why.

Decline button

  • Below the “Match” button there should be a grey button: [x icon] Not a good match
  • If the guest clicks this button the decline modal opens.

Decline modal

  • Background behind the modal has a dark overlay
  • Headline: Why is this venue not a good match?
  • Checkbox options (one or more can be selected)
    • Fetched from https://headbox.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-5376
  • Secondary Button: < Back to message
  • Button: Submit
  • A click on the area around the modal or on the secondary button closes the modal, the venue is not declined.
  • The submit button closes the modal and saves the selected options. The venue is now declined and the declined state is shown.
    • Do a refetch like match
  • If no option is selected or if only “Other reason” is selected and the input field contains less than 3 characters (blank spaces don’t count) and the submit button is clicked, then the following validation message should be displayed above the buttons: Please select at least one reason.

If no option is selected or if only “Other reason” os selected and the input field contains less than 3 characters (blank spaces don’t count) and the submit button is clicked, then the following validation message should be displayed above the buttons: Please select at least one reason.

Design

  • Pre decline: https://www.figma.com/file/zerDeP0FSvQfMhyloYKANR/Guest-experience?node-id=1639%3A22840
  • Modal https://www.figma.com/file/zerDeP0FSvQfMhyloYKANR/Guest-experience?node-id=1639%3A23140
item.summary: Guest - Message page - Decline venue

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software

item.title: [DEV-5327] Guest - Enquiry page - Decline venue
item.description:
We want to give our guests the option to decline venues that have messaged them so they can have a better overview of their options and eventually we want to pass this feedback on to our hosts.

No message state

  • If the guest hasn’t received a message the declined panel is not displayed.

At least one message state

  • If the guest has received at least one message from a host the declined panel is displayed below the matches panel.
  • Headline: Venues you didn’t like ��
  • Illustration
  • Copy: Mark venues as not a good match and they will appear here. This frees up space for more venues to message you

At least one declined message state

  • All venues the guest has declined are displayed in the declined panel instead of the empty state illustration
  • Headline: Venues you didn’t like ��
  • Subtitle: You told us these venues aren’t a good match for your enquiry, which frees up space for more venues to message you.
  • The venue picture and the tags (if there are any) should be at around 60% opacity.
    • Play with brightness and saturation to get something which matches design
  • Instead of the envelop icon and the messaging time the following is displayed instead below the venue picture:
    [x icon] x hours ago
    (Note: How long ago the guest clicked “Decline”. We use this component in the LF in other places, says hours/days/weeks ago.)
  • Secondary button: View venue
  • The declined venues are ordered by date and time with the oldest decline on the left/top.
  • Clicking on any of the venue elements/the button should open up the corresponding venue page.

Designs

  • Empty state https://www.figma.com/file/zerDeP0FSvQfMhyloYKANR/Guest-experience?node-id=1639%3A22687
  • With venue https://www.figma.com/file/zerDeP0FSvQfMhyloYKANR/Guest-experience?node-id=1639%3A23624
  • Ask Ellen for character illustrations.
item.summary: Guest - Enquiry page - Decline venue

status.description: This status is managed internally by Jira Software
